org.openntf.domino.helpers

Class DocumentSyncHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openntf.domino.helpers.DocumentSyncHelper

  • public class DocumentSyncHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    DocumentSyncHelper class This class provides a quick and easy way to sync fields or formulas from a DocumentCollection to related documents, e.g. from Companies to Contacts for those companies, or States to Contacts for those states.
    1. Create a map of updates to make to related documents
      • Key is Item to pull from source document or formula to be processed against source document
      • Value is Item name to wrote to on target documents
    2. Create a new instance of DocumentSyncHelper
    4. Either in constructor or separately, define the strategy to apply when updating target documents
    5. Either in constructor or separately, load in the map
    6. Either in constructor or separately, define target server
    7. Either in constructor or separately, define target database
    8. Either in constructor or separately, define target view name
    9. Either in constructor or separately, define field in source to use as a key for target view
    10. Get a DocumentCollection of source document(s)
    11. Pass to DocumentSyncHelper.process method
    Example:
    Database currDb = XSPUtil.getCurrentDatabase(); java.util.Map syncMap = new java.util.HashMap(); syncMap.put("Key", "State"); syncMap.put("Name", "StateName"); syncMap.put("@Now", "LastSync"); DocumentSyncHelper helper = new DocumentSyncHelper(DocumentSyncHelper.Strategy.CREATE_AND_REPLACE, syncMap, currDb.getServer(), currDb.getFilePath(), "AllContactsByState", "Key"); View states = currDb.getView("AllStates"); DocumentCollection sourceCollection = states.getAllDocuments(); helper.process(sourceCollection); Alternatively, sync settings can be held in a control document. Use a Map to map DocumentSyncHelper properties to Item names on the control document, e.g. Map has key Controls.TARGET_SERVER=ServerName will look for an Item called ServerName on the control document to retrieve the server name to use in the DocumentSyncHelper

      • DocumentSyncHelper

        public DocumentSyncHelper()
        Instantiates a new document sync helper.
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • DocumentSyncHelper

        public DocumentSyncHelper(Document controlDoc,
                          java.util.Map<DocumentSyncHelper.Controls,java.lang.String> controlMap)
        Instantiates a new DocumentSyncHelper with a Document of sync settings and a Map of field names for each setting in the control doc
        Parameters:
        controlDoc - Document with Items for relevant settings for the DocumentSyncHelper
        controlMap - Map of Item names to use to retrieve DocumentSyncHelper settings from the control doc
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • DocumentSyncHelper

        public DocumentSyncHelper(DocumentSyncHelper.Strategy strategy,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.String> syncMap,
                          java.lang.String... args)
        Instantiates a new document sync helper passing in a sync map
        Parameters:
        strategy - the strategy
        syncMap - the sync map
        args - the args, up to four, each in order is:
        1. target server
        2. target filepath
        3. target lookup view
        4. formula to apply to each source document to get key for target documents. E.g. "ContactID" = use ContactID field of source document as key value to apply to target lookup view to get the collection to update
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

                         java.util.Date sinceDate)
        Extended method to process, allowing the developer to define to only process source documents modified since a given Java date

        sourceDb - Database source documents are in
        sinceDate - Date since when documents should have been modified
